page.title: 06PRINCIPLE FEATURES EASTLEIGH
page.content: The predominant feature of Eastleigh is the railway which is given a full page. Through the centre of the block ,to the east of the town is the{River {Itchen}which is a typical Hampshire trout stream. There is a interesting remnant of the canal age still existing.The{Itchen {Navigation Canal}is still a waterway but there are no surviving locks.It can be traced from Southampton to Winchester. The centre of Eastleigh is at present undergoing great changes.A large covered shopping precinct is planned for the future and a lot of old buildings are at present being demolished to make way for it.
